title: Revolution reveal ‘Independence Day’ jersey
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution unveiled a special 'Independence Day' jersey for the 2026 and 2027 MLS seasons.
The jersey features a fireworks-themed design and will be paired with navy shorts and red, white, and blue socks.
Fans can purchase the new jersey at pop-up locations in Boston's Old State House and Ducali Pizzeria & Bar on February 10.

title: About a dozen vehicles damaged by a bridge joint on I-91 in Western Mass.
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: About a dozen vehicles were damaged on I-91 in Western Massachusetts due to a protruding bridge joint.
MassDOT and State Police responded to the scene, cutting down the elevated joint and assisting disabled vehicles.
Drivers can file claims for personal injury, not property damage, with a recovery limit of $4,000 per state law.

title: North Andover officer shot by colleague argues judge is biased and should be removed
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Kelsey Fitzsimmons filed a motion alleging Judge Kathleen McCarthy-Neyman is biased and should be removed from her case.
Fitzsimmons's lawyers claim McCarthy-Neyman conducted an unauthorized investigation, showing bias and a conflict of interest.
A hearing on the recusal motion is scheduled for March 9, with Fitzsimmons's jury trial set to begin on March 23.

title: Eli Lilly snaps up Watertown biotech in $2.4 billion deal
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Eli Lilly acquires Watertown-based Orna Therapeutics for $2.4 billion to expand genetic medicines and cell therapies.
Orna Therapeutics develops treatments using circular RNA and lipid particles to engineer immune cells inside the body.
Eli Lilly previously purchased Massachusetts companies Scorpion Therapeutics and Verve Therapeutics for $2.5 billion and $1.13 billion respectively.

title: Boston man paroled after serving 16 years of life sentence for fatal stabbing outside bar
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Corey Patterson granted parole after serving 16 years for 2009 murder outside an Allston bar.
Massachusetts Parole Board cited Patterson's sobriety, education, and community work in parole decision.
Patterson's parole includes electronic monitoring, curfew, and prohibition from contacting victim's family.

title: ‘You’re going to feel the pain’: Kurt Warner’s advice to Drake Maye after losing Super Bowl LX
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots lose Super Bowl LX to the Seahawks with a 29-13 defeat, despite a promising season under quarterback Drake Maye.
Kurt Warner advises Maye to process both successes and failures, drawing from Warner's Super Bowl experiences.
Patriots' 2025 season marked a turnaround with Mike Vrabel's coaching after consecutive 4-13 records.

title: Making movies, like making sausages, is not pretty. Just ask John Sayles.
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: John Sayles, Oscar-nominated director, discusses his novel 'Crucible' and the state of cinema ahead of local appearances.
'Crucible' is set in Detroit during Prohibition and explores themes of class conflict and Henry Ford's industrial ambitions.
Sayles talked about the challenges of adapting stories for screen versus novels, impacted by budget constraints in filmmaking.

title: Can you find your partner on a stoop in Southie? The creator of Boston’s ‘Stoop Dating’ thinks so.
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Stoop Dating, a Boston-based social media dating show, has gained over 30,000 Instagram and 40,000 TikTok followers.
Julz Radley created the show to promote face-to-face interactions, moving away from traditional dating apps.
Episodes are filmed on a Southie porch, with singles deciding whether to go on a second date after an hour-long meeting.

title: 2 charged in Brockton killing after months as fugitives, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Micheal Thompson, 35, and Dayana Slade, 25, arrested in Lewiston, Maine for the fatal shooting of Mike Jonas.
Thompson charged with first-degree murder; pleaded not guilty, held without bail; Slade charged as accessory with $250,000 bail.
Shooting occurred in Brockton's Finnegan Park; Jonas had gunshot and stab wounds; incident followed an altercation.

title: Red Sox reportedly tried to trade for standout shortstop this offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox sought to trade for Los Angeles Angels shortstop Zach Neto during the offseason, but could not meet the asking price.
Zach Neto, 25, is known for solid defense and power, posting two consecutive 20-20 seasons and 49 homers over two years.
Instead, the Red Sox acquired infielder Caleb Durbin from the Brewers, who finished third in the NL Rookie of the Year voting.
